text: Jean Cottard (14 July 1926 – 1 December 2020) was a French fencer. He earned his Master of Arms at Fort Carré in 1949. He became the first National Technical Director of France in 1964. He was a member of the French Federation of Fencing from 1988 until his death. Cottard was born in Paris. Cottard died on 1 December 2020 in Antibes, France at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:French fencers Category:Sportspeople from Paris
title: Jean Cottard
